item.description:
The trails at Walden Pond are conducive to running and the water temperature is just right for rejuvenation.  I figured we would start around the pond and then head across the railroad tracks into Lincoln.  After a few miles we will return to the pond and find a spot for a refreshing swim. 

The pace will be fairly easy between 9 & 10 minute/miles. The total distance should be about 4 miles.

If you plan to go in the water,  bring a towel. They have restrooms for changing at the beach.

There's a parking lot in front of the pond on Rt 126. The parking fee is $5
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of the gift shop at 9:00am. I'll post my cell number here later.

group.name: Boston Informal Running Club: Home of TMIRCE:BOS

item.name: Walden Pond Trail Run and Swim
